8e3g C 78 D 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines.

3qb4 A 84 C 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between two units of Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines.

Peptide A name
Growth/differentiation factor 5
Peptide B name
Growth/differentiation factor 5
Peptide A accession
P43026
Peptide B accession
P43026
Peptide A residue number
465 (Residue 84 in this structure)
Peptide B residue number
465 (Residue 84 in this structure)

8e3g C 47 D 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

In SYNS2; reduction in binding affinity with BMPR2; no change in binding affinity with BMPR1A; no change in binding affinity with BMPR1B; decreases induction of SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex phosphorylation; delay of phosphotylated SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex nuclear translocation; strong reduction of SMAD protein signal transduction; reduction of chondrocyte differentiation; strong improvement of chondrogenesis; decrease of NOG binding; resistant to NOG inhibition; no chondrogenesis inhibition; dbSNP:rs121909347.

8e3g A 78 B 85

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide A name

Peptide B name

Peptide A accession
P12643
Peptide B accession
P43026
Peptide A residue number
360 (Residue 78 in this structure)
Peptide B residue number
433 (Residue 52 in this structure)

8e3g C 79 D 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

465 (Residue 84 in this structure)

8e3g A 78 B 19

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide A name

Peptide B name

Peptide A accession
P12643
Peptide B accession
P43026
Peptide A residue number
296 (Residue 14 in this structure)
Peptide B residue number
465 (Residue 84 in this structure)

8e3g A 78 B 48

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

8e3g C 43 D 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide A name
Bone morphogenetic protein 2
Peptide B name
Growth/differentiation factor 5
Peptide A accession
P12643
Peptide B accession
P43026
Peptide A residue number
395 (Residue 113 in this structure)
Peptide B residue number
465 (Residue 84 in this structure)

8e3g A 78 B 119

A redox-regulated disulphide may form between Bone morphogenetic protein 2 and Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Growth/differentiation factor 5

Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

2bhk A 83 A 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide accession

Residue number A
400 (Residue 19 in this structure)
Residue number B
429 (Residue 48 in this structure)
Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

2bhk A 18 A 83

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide accession

Residue number A

Residue number B
465 (Residue 83 in this structure)
Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

8e3g B 85 B 119

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

3qb4 A 52 A 84

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

2bhk A 47 A 83

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

3evs B 117 B 119

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

3qb4 C 52 C 117

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Growth/differentiation factor 5

8e3g B 84 B 119

Redox score
63.11
PDB code
8e3g
Structure name
bmp2/gdf5 heterodimer
Structure deposition date
2022-08-17
Thiol separation (Å)
8.91
Half-sphere exposure sum
83
Minimum pKa
nan
% buried
nan
Peptide accession
P43026
Residue number A
465 (Residue 84 in this structure)
Residue number B
500 (Residue 119 in this structure)
Peptide name
Growth/differentiation factor 5

8e3g D 48 D 119

A redox-regulated disulphide may form within Growth/differentiation factor 5 at these cysteines. However, the redox score of this cysteine pair is lower than any known redox-active disulphide.

Relevent regions

In AMD2B, SYNS2 and BDA2; the mutant is almost inactive; loss of binding to BMPR1A and BMPR1B ectodomains; no induction of SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex phosphorylation; impairs nuclear translocation of phosphotylated SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex; no ability to induce SMAD protein signal transduction; binds to NOG; dbSNP:rs28936683.

L
variation residue
P
position

score
100.0
distance
5.496846
seq distance
12
chain

In SYNS2; reduction in binding affinity with BMPR2; no change in binding affinity with BMPR1A; no change in binding affinity with BMPR1B; decreases induction of SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex phosphorylation; delay of phosphotylated SMAD1-SMAD5-SMAD8 protein complex nuclear translocation; strong reduction of SMAD protein signal transduction; reduction of chondrocyte differentiation; strong improvement of chondrogenesis; decrease of NOG binding; resistant to NOG inhibition; no chondrogenesis inhibition; dbSNP:rs121909347.
